name: The Downtown Bozeman Guest House
description: Welcome to your home in downtown Bozeman! This 3-bedroom, 1,500 sq. foot house has been our home for 16 years and we are excited to now share it with guests and visitors to Bozeman. This is as close to downtown a single-family home can be. Only two blocks to Main Street and 100 yards to Dave’s Sushi. This home was built in 1918 and the second story was added in 2002. The open, spacious downstairs living area is the perfect place to call home while you explore all that the Bozeman area offers.
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's northeast neighborhood consists of charming and eclectic homes with easy access to downtown and great parks.
host_about: I moved to Bozeman in 2002 to ski-bum and...never left! I work for a Bozeman-based adventure travel company that plans trips to Yellowstone, Montana, and other beautiful natural places beyond. Extending this hospitality to hosting guests at our home has been very rewarding. I hope you have fun exploring all that Bozeman and the surrounding area offers. It's worth checking out!

neighborhood_overview:
This delightful Montana apartment for 4 is located in an upscale neighborhood of Bozeman. It’s a quiet and pleasant location that’s ideal for families or couples to escape to for a weekend, week, or longer, and for remote workers looking for somewhere to base themselves in Montana.

The property sits in the heart of walking & biking trails, parks, and all kinds of outdoor adventures, making it the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana have to offer on foot, bikes or by car.

Nearby places you might be interested in checking out during your stay include:

Yellowstone National Park - always a big attraction for people from all over the world with views, trails and landscapes you’ll remember for a lifetime.

Montana State University - the largest university in the state is close by, so if you’re a student or parents of a student looking to study here, the chalet is a great place to base yourselves while you’re chec
host_about:
I am a 30-something local resident of Bozeman, MT where I live and work as a VP at a digital transformation agency. 

I love traveling and spending time with my friends and family.  I enjoy all outdoor activities, hiking, backpacking, camping, fly fishing and watching football. 

Cheers!

description: Come be one of the first to stay at our Bozeman Bison Bunker just minutes from Montana State University. With a view of the M and just a 5 minute drive to the University, you won't find a better space during your stay in Bozeman. neighborhood_overview: Gran Cielo is the manifestation of our dedication to create community through a common living space. While its million-dollar views, unmatched central park, and easy access to downtown Bozeman and the wild beyond make Gran Cielo an enticing location, it’s the sense of classic community that sets it apart. Whether you’re looking for your first home, a bit more space, or somewhere to settle indefinitely, Gran Cielo offers a sophisticated array of home types, sizes and styles. name: Bozeman's Main Stay the heart of downtown Bozeman
description: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. We are in the center of Bozeman with  it's wonderful restaurants and amazing downtown. The Bozeman's Main Stay is a historic home built in 1908 and one of a handful of homes still on Main St  We are just a short drive from Bridger Bowl and Big Sky ski resorts, as well as Yellowstone National Park and the world renowned Gallatin river.  Also minutes from the Yellowstone International airport, please come and enjoy.
neighborhood_overview:
Bozeman's main stay is located right on Main Street of Bozeman. We are so very close (just a block or two ) to the downtown area and its many wonderful restaurants and shops. We are also 1 block from The Wilson auditorium Which brings in the Bozeman Symphony and wonderful performances During the holidays.
We look forward to you staying with us.
host_about: I was born and raised in Bozeman I love this community and all that it has to give.  I enjoy all types of outdoors activities with my husband and son we love skiing, Boating and riding horses you name it we love to do it.

name: The Sweet Spot-Downtown Luxury *Walk Everywhere!*
description:
The Sweet Spot , located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors, truly the SWEET SPOT. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. Enjoy this newly built duplex, with contemporary and stylish amenities. Welcome to Bozeman, "the most livable town."
STR23-00052
neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities. Enjoy the being minutes away from the top fly fishing in the United States, ski hills, hiking trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
30 min or less to the Gallatin, Yellowstone and Madison Rivers.
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

name: Spacious 3Bdm Gallatin Green Condo | Trail Access
description:
Experience the best of Southwest Montana! This stunning condo has been thoughtfully designed for ultimate comfort, convenience, and entertainment. It offers high-end finishes, lots of space, and stylish furnishings to ensure an exceptional stay. Conveniently located on a trail system, the condo has easy access to various parks and playgrounds and serves as the perfect home base for your adventures.

*Fireplace & Smart TV
*Wifi + dedicated workspace
*Full kitchen & laundry
*Fantastic views
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is located in a residential neighborhood in Northwest Bozeman, offering a serene retreat while being conveniently close to shopping areas. It serves as an ideal base camp for exploring the many recreational opportunities for which Bozeman is known. Downtown Bozeman and Montana State University are just an 11-minute drive away, Bridger Bowl is approximately 28 minutes away, and Big Sky Resort is an hour's drive from the condo.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: The Bison Abode - Spacious Home 2 Bedrooms
description:
Oh come to this home near where the buffalo roam, whether to work or as home base for play. Where seldom is heard a discouragin' word, and the fireplace is cozy all day.

This spacious, comfortable and well-appointed home in a quiet neighborhood is the perfect abode for your Bozeman visit. neighborhood_overview: Convenient, friendly neighborhood with a park a large regional park just 3 blocks away with walking trails and ponds.
host_about:
Please call me Bob! I am the founder and chief scientist at the Yellowstone Ecological Research Center (YERC). Over my 30-plus years working in the Greater Yellowstone, my research interests have sought a more holistic connection between nature, people, and technology. That’s led to what I call “Adaptive Ecology,” studying not only how ecosystems adapt to changing conditions, but how the science of ecology must adapt to social and technological changes as well. That focus drives YERC’s mission today.

Personally, I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and finding common ground among cultures and communities.  I love sharing my knowledge of the Greater Yellowstone area and ecology, the best places to spot local wildlife, and my favorite watering holes in the area.

name: Lush Victorian garden with Bridger views
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located place.

This ground floor room with private bathroom is the perfect place to start your Bozeman and beyond adventures.

This room features a king size bed with a foam mattress.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. name: Peaceful garden setting with 3 bedrooms
description: Enjoy easy access to popular shops and restaurants from this charming place to stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's something delicious available at most hours of the day.

description: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! This historic three bedroom is located just one block from downtown. With a fresh remodel the space is cozy and clean with lots of bright, natural light! Just a few steps from Bozeman's infamous Maine Street puts you in walking distance to all the shopping, dining, and events that downtown has to offer! Perfect for a family get away or for those looking to enjoy all that Bozeman can provide!
neighborhood_overview: Walk 1 block south and you will run into Main street. The bulk of Main street consists of about 8 blocks or bars restaurants and retail shops. There is a small local foods co-op a couple blocks east on main under 1/4 of a mile. There is a cute and safe residential neighborhood to the north. Beall Park is 1/2 mile from the property and Linley park is closer to a mile. Both great places to take the dog!
host_about: Jammin Jackalope manages a variety of accommodations in Southwestern, Montana. We have camping and cabin rentals in Paradise Valley, a small bungalow in downtown Bozeman, and a cozy condo in Big Sky. We are a family team based in Bozeman that loves to explore the outdoors and share opportunities for others to adventure in Montana’s wide-open spaces.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in Valley West, an award winning family friendly planned community that has parks, walking trails, a lake with a pavilion and a playground all within walking distance. name: The Westside Bozeman Nook - Cozy Destination
description:
Centrally located in Gallatin County, 60 minutes to Big Sky Resort, 30 minutes to Bridger Bowl, 10 minutes to downtown Bozeman, 10 minutes to Montana State University, walking distance to shops and restaurants on the growing west side of town.

Valley West is a great neighborhood on the west side of town with in walking distance to The Ridge ( a gym), a juice bar, a yoga studio, Polar Brewing ( brewery), restaurants Tanglewood, Sidewinders, Hachi Sushi, Foxtrot (also a coffee stop) .
The neighborhood is mostly full of families.
There is a nice mature tress and custom houses to enjoy a walk around with a cup of coffee. If you go a block east you will find a large pond full of ducks along with a community park with walking trails.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Garden grotto with wood stove
description: Find yourself surrounded by a lush summer garden or peaceful winter snow in this beautiful room with walk out private garden terrace. Sporting high ceilings from the completely new foundation supporting this fully renovated 1890 building, this room is cozy yet expansive. When you step out of the sliding glass doors to your private terrace, you forget that you're in the middle of downtown. The sunken nature of this pristine space makes the outside city fall away.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's something delicious available at most hours of the day.

name: Little Yellow House - Downtown Charming 2 BDRM
description: Welcome to our cheerful, warm and cozy "little yellow house" located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in the surrounding nature and parks--all within a 5-minute walk to central downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl ski area, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by Erin, an Airbnb Superhost, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival, Bungalow/craftsman, and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Bright + Modern Central Condo
description: Welcome to this bright and modern centrally located home!  A two-story, row-style condo with three bedrooms and 2.5 baths, this beautiful space, filled with natural light is conveniently located for exploring Bozeman and nearby attractions like Yellowstone National Park and Big Sky Ski Resort. Only 10 minutes to downtown Bozeman, and close to restaurants, shops, groceries and public transportation.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is centrally located.  It is a short drive to downtown, the N 19th Ave shopping center, and the new Whole Foods.  There are grocery stores, parks, and shopping close by.    It is a quiet, safe, and friendly neighborhood.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Sarah!  I'm a born and raised Alaskan and love everything outdoors, rain, snow, or shine.  I've lived in Bozeman for the better part of a decade so needless to say I'm a wealth of information for all of the best spots.  

I've worked in the service industry for many years and pride myself on being a good host, whether its giving you your space or pointing you in the direction of the best dining experiences, outdoor recreating spots, or community activity.

I'm a low-key traveler who occasionally has a dog in tow.  I love crossword puzzles, mornings, Italian wine, and food.  And climbing.  And running.  Also, animals and puns.

name: Modern 3Bdrm Stay | Mountain Views & Beach Access
description:
Welcome to Drishti House - a luxurious retreat nestled by the picturesque shoreline of Bozeman Beach. It features 3 spacious bedrooms, each with its own en-suite bathroom for ultimate comfort and privacy, and makes it the perfect getaway for friends, families, or groups. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Bridger Mountains throughout the home and easy access to a shared beach and nearby hiking and biking trails.

*Cozy fireplace
*Chef's kitchen
*Patios with seating
*3-story layout
*Laundry
neighborhood_overview:
The home is situated in the newly developed residential area of Bridger Vale on Bozeman's north side, offering stunning views and a peaceful ambiance. This area is home to Bozeman Beach, a popular summer destination bustling with swimmers, paddle-boarders, small watercraft, and beach volleyball enthusiasts. Just across the water or a short drive away, you can enjoy MAP Brewing and various other local amenities.

Get to downtown Bozeman in approximately 7 minutes by vehicle! Here you will find everything you need including grocery stores, pharmacies, shopping, dining, and more!

With easy access to I-90 and only 16 miles to Bridger Bowl, this is a perfect location for exploring all that Bozeman and the Gallatin Valley have to offer.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone Nationa
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Parkside Paradise at Gran Cielo
description:
Welcome to your Parkside Paradise at Gran Cielo! This one-of-a-kind accommodation is the perfect choice for travelers who want to experience something truly special during their stay.

From the moment you step inside, you'll be immersed in a world of artistic inspiration and imagination. The interior of the rental is decorated with vibrant colors, intricate patterns, and unique furnishings that reflect the creativity and passion of artist/owners.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about:
Family. Friends. Mountains. Skiing. Real Estate. Photography. Big Adventures. 

Relationships are the most important thing in life, and time spent with friends and family is what I live for. The number of great friends that I met because of Airbnb is an ever-growing list that can no longer can be counted with just fingers and toes. 

Being a host has allowed me to travel and meet others without ever boarding a plane. It is a beautiful thing for me to learn about my guests and share my love for Big Sky and the mountains with them. 

And I believe that in all things, aesthetics matter.

description: Experience downtown Bozeman, Montana at this centrally-located suite! neighborhood_overview:
South of Main Street filled with some of Bozeman’s most historic residences. Quiet streets lined with mature trees and towering Victorian-era homes distinguish this neighborhood. Residences are generally on smaller lots, with many having multiple units and shared back alley access. The Gallagator Linear Trail meanders throughout, connecting neighbors from Main Street to Kagy.

Great for those that want to stay in historic “old Bozeman” and be within walking distance from farmer’s markets and downtown events.

1-4 minutes to downtown

name: 2 bedroom apt in the heart of downtown Bozeman
description:
Charming apt in the heart of vibrant downtown Bozeman. Just steps away from amazing restaurants, cafes, bars, breweries, and unique shops. Perfect getaway to explore all that the Bozeman area has to offer from world class summer (fly fishing, mountain biking, river rafting, and hiking) and winter (downhill skiing, x-country skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing) recreational activities, to the wonders of Yellowstone National Park.
* Loft area is available for an additional sleeping.
neighborhood_overview: This apt. is located in the heart of downtown Bozeman where the atmosphere is always lively and fun.  Downtown Bozeman is home to a variety of amazing restaurant's that cater to a range of tastes and preferences.  Galleries, unique boutiques and shopping galore just steps away from the apt.

Located right next to walk/bike to parks, eateries and shops.Only 55 mins to Big Sky, 29 mins to Bridger Bowl, 5 mins to Montana State, 1hr and 20 mins to Yellowstone. Our goal is for an stress-free and relaxing stay!

name: West side stay - 10 minutes to everywhere
description:
This is a great space for a Basecamp to your outdoor adventures here in Bozeman. Whether it’s skiing, fishing, or visiting family.
There’s extra space in the garage for storage or gear repairs.
I’m happy to give recommendations on the local attractions.
The room is spacious with a plush king sized bed and up stairs away from the main area in a shared home so you can expect a lot of privacy.
There’s also a set of friendly yet shy retired sled dogs around from time to time.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet neighborhood full of families and mature landscaping making it a great place to walk with a cup of coffee.
There is a pond just a block east with a large park to enjoy one a walk.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Cozy Valley West Studio | Full Kitchen & Laundry
description:
Whether planning a weekend getaway or an extended stay, this cozy, well-equipped studio is your gateway to relaxation and adventure in Bozeman. Located in the idyllic Valley West neighborhood, enjoy free parking, stunning mountain views, and proximity to a picturesque pond and park. It offers a full kitchen, bathroom, comfy bed, and essentials to make you feel right at home.

*Pet-friendly stay
*Dual washer/dryer
*Air conditioning unit
*Dedicated workspace and wifi
*Great neighborhood
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Valley West, one of Bozeman’s most desirable neighborhoods. It’s surrounded by trails, a large beautiful pond with mountains as the backdrop, and numerous lovely parks. It’s the perfect location for easy access to outdoor spaces!

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Gorgeous Midtown Condo
description: This 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo features 180-degree views of the Bridger Mountains. The oversized north-facing window baths the room in natural light. It has a full kitchen, living area, 1 king bed, 1 bunk bed, 2 showers, walk in closet, and laundry. Outdoor roof top entertaining space for guests. The condo is upstairs from Ponderosa social club, Ceremony salon and spa, and Bourbon BBQ. Walking distance from lots of local favorites including Freefall Brewery, The Elm, and Access Fitness.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has many food and entertainment options. Across the parking lot is Ceremony Salon and Spa and Audreys Pizza & Freefall Brewery. Walking distance to many local favorites including and The Elm music venue, Cats paw bar, Genuine Ice Cream, and Farmers Daughter breakfast cafe. There is also a two food truck parks a short walk away. Downtown is a short six block walk away, to a plethora of shopping and dining options!

name: Downtown Charming & Cozy Casita - 3 BDRM
description: This downtown 3-Bedroom charming casita has a unique western-vintage style and is conveniently located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in the surrounding nature and parks within a 5-minute walk to downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by Erin, a Superhost, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with leafy trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Downtown Dream house
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located home. Lots of space both inside and out. Lovely yard with fire pit, a front porch with rockers, and a breeze way for easy dry access to the kitchen or a great place to grill and hang out. Walk to campus and town from this convenient location.

3 bedrooms, two up and one down, each with a queen bed, 2 full baths w/towels etc, kitchen, dining-room and livingroom have loads of windows. Stone fireplace adds extra charm.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Waters 1Bd Apt in Valley West | King Bd + Laundry
description:
Our charming apartment in the heart of Valley West awaits you! Nestled in one of Bozeman’s most idyllic neighborhoods, this lovely, private retreat offers the perfect blend of comfort + convenience. Whether you're seeking a cozy weekend getaway or a home base for a month's visit, you'll find everything you need here. Enjoy stunning mountain views, free parking, and a picturesque park and pond just a 1/2 block away.

*Dedicated workspace + wifi
*Laundry
*Private patio
*King bed
*Great location
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Valley West, one of Bozeman’s most desirable neighborhoods. It’s the perfect location for easy access to outdoor spaces! It is only a half block from the beautiful Valley West Park, pond, and trail system. You’ll also be close to MSU, downtown Bozeman, and Four Corners (on the way to Big Sky).

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

description: Fantastic house and yard, 3 blocks from Main Street and right on Bozeman Creek as well as at the end of the street. New property starting in 2023! High speed wifi. A/C

host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Your Downtown Urban Sanctuary: Downtown Luxury!
description:
Discover serenity at the NamaStay Condo Retreat, a haven of tranquility nestled in the heart of Beautiful Downtown Bozeman, Montana. Immerse yourself in a space thoughtfully adorned with a yoga-inspired touches, offering luxury and comfort for a truly rejuvenating escape. Just moments away from vibrant Main Street, NamaStay invites you to explore the city's delightful array of eateries, boutiques, artistic gems, and vibrant nightlife. Embrace the perfect union of urban convenient.
STR23-00086
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. name: Spacious 1Bdrm Guest Suite Near MSU and Downtown
description:
This modern basement apartment offers abundant natural light and a clean, functional layout. Designed by the homeowner as a guest suite for family and friends, it features new, comfortable furnishings and offers ample privacy from the main house. Step outside to the backyard and enjoy the fresh mountain air.

*Wifi + dedicated workspace
*Kitchenette great for reheating and storing food
*Family-friendly w/ amenities catering to children
*Plenty of essentials
*Close to MSU and Downtown
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment resides in a secure residential neighborhood, conveniently located just 1.8 miles south of the Museum of the Rockies and MSU. It's surrounded by parks, walking trails, mature trees, manicured lawns, and families.

The home is 3 miles from downtown Bozeman, 14 miles from Bozeman Airport, 20 miles from Bridger Bowl ski area, 50 miles from Big Sky Resort, 80 miles from Gardiner (North Entrance to Yellowstone National Park), and 90 miles from West Yellowstone.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries. You're a walk or a bike ride
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

Pagoda Peaks is 2.5 miles from downtown Bozeman, 16 miles to Bridger Bowl Ski Area, 52 miles to Big Sky Resort, and 90 miles to Yellowstone National Park.

The area features endless hiking and mountain biking trails, blue-ribbon trout streams, and Nordic and Alpine Ski areas.

name: Bridger Hawk - Mid-Century Classic (NEW)
description: Discover Bozeman's charm from our mid-century 3BR, 2BA home! Minutes from downtown, with Bridger Mountain views, indulge in luxury with hotel-style amenities, a wood fireplace, and comfy beds. Enjoy a spacious backyard & garage—perfect for snowy days. Close to nature & city delights, it’s a haven for relaxation and adventure. Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or an exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for your MT journey.
neighborhood_overview:
Beyond the confines of this home away from home, Bozeman's cultural and natural treasures await. Find yourself just minutes from artisan boutiques, eclectic eateries, and buzzing nightlife downtown. Or answer the call of the wild as you venture into the mountain trails, picturesque hikes, and panoramic vistas of the Bridgers.

Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or a comprehensive exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for a journey steeped in comfort and style. The soul of the past meets the spirit of the present, right here, beneath the vast Montana skies. Welcome home!

STR23-00019
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

description:
* 4 Bed/4 bath
* 3 King Suites
* Bunkroom
* Gorgeous mountain or lake views from every room
* Smart TVs in all rooms
* EV charger
* Sauna
* Pack n play/ high chair/ baby gate

* Miles of hiking and biking trails directly out the back door
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled within a quaint development of 20 recently built luxury townhomes, our residence offers a prime location directly opposite Glen Rotary Lake. This picturesque lake provides a gateway to various recreational activities such as fishing, swimming, and kayaking. The surrounding area features a scenic walking path encircling the lake, leading conveniently to the MAP Brewing Company—a fantastic spot for dining, drinks, and live music. Step out the back door, and you'll discover an extensive network of hiking and biking trails that wind their way alongside the scenic East Gallatin River.

Within walking distance, you'll also find Gildhouse Suites, a venue that houses a delightful coffee shop and a comprehensive salon/spa experience.

The convenience continues with our home being just minutes away from downtown Bozeman, while a short 20-minute drive takes you to the slopes of Bridger Ski Resort. Enjoy the perfect blend of tranquility and accessibility at our locatio
host_about: Hello! Thank you for considering a stay at our home! We are an active family that loves to travel. We also love hosting fellow travelers! We are available for questions 8am-6pm MST or in case of emergency.

name: Spacious Family Home | Privacy, Backyard w/ Patio
description:
Have fun making memories in this nostalgic, family-friendly retreat! The spacious backyard with a patio and outdoor seating is perfect for family fun and relaxation. With 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and ample space, you'll enjoy all the amenities for a convenient and comfortable stay.

*Full kitchen
*Two living rooms
*Highchair and Pack 'n Play
*Dedicated workspace
*Washer and dryer
*Beautiful location
neighborhood_overview:
The home is nestled in a charming, tree-lined residential area of Bozeman, offering a serene neighborhood atmosphere while being conveniently close to essential businesses and exciting attractions.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.

It’s less than a mile to Gallatin Valley Mall and Whole Foods and 2.7 miles to downtown Bozeman. Find cute coffee shops, great dining options, bars, cool boutiques, and much more in the vibrant downtown! The home is also 10 miles to the airport, 20 miles to Bridger Bowl, 47 miles to Big Sky Resort, and
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Fisherman’s Folly
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience, within a spacious centrally-located home.

Fully remodeled mid-century. Ten minute walk to main street with its restaurants, breweries, boutiques and galleries.

This is the owner’s principal residence so they’ve made it very warm and comfortable.

Double doors open to a patio and large backyard filled with plantings and whimsical touches. On the front side theres a lovely sitting area with a solo fire stove to enjoy.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Downtown Chic Urban Abode
description: Located in downtown Bozeman this fully renovated condo is housed in a historical commercial building on Main Street. Amenities include: a fully equipped kitchen, granite countertops, gallery lighting, collectible art prints, high-end furniture, library, wood floors, high ceilings, laundry, smart tv, separate heat and air conditioning.  Quiet and cozy;this home is a hidden gem!
neighborhood_overview: The walkability is amazing from the condo with restaurants, coffee houses, retail stores, libraries, museums, co-ops, theaters, cultural centers all within walking distance.
host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

neighborhood_overview: Alder Creek is a quiet neighborhood on Bozeman's southside with a park-like feel. It has fantastic mountain views, scenic walking trails, a central park and Alder Creek running through the area. The neighborhood consists of modern homes designed for family living. It is located just a short walk from Montana State University and has easy access to a variety of outdoor recreation areas, hiking rails and ski areas in and around Bozeman.

name: Modern Bozeman Escape w/ Bridger Mountain Views!
description: Experience a trip to Montana from this spacious 4-bedroom, 4-bath townhome with stunning mountain views. Located a few miles from downtown Bozeman and close to outdoor adventures, this vacation rental is the perfect home base. Walk to the waterfront at Glen Rotary Park, hit the slopes at Bridger Bowl Ski Area, or spend a day exploring Yellowstone National Park. After a day of adventure, relax by the fireplace or gather around the dining table for a memorable evening with family and friends.
neighborhood_overview:
DOWNTOWN SITES (~2 miles): Bozeman Co-op West Main, Emerson Center for the Arts & Culture, Willson Auditorium, Gallatin History Museum, City of Bozeman Bogert Park, Peets Hill/Burke Park, Lindley Park, Gallagator Trail, shops, restaurants, cafes, lounges
OUTDOOR RECREATION: Glen Rotary Park (on-site), Bridger Creek Golf Course (2 miles), Gallatin County Regional Park (4 miles), Montana Grizzly Encounter (14 miles), Bridger Bowl Ski Area (16 miles), Custer Gallatin National Forest (66 miles), Yellowstone National Park (80 miles)
FAMILY ATTRACTIONS: Bozeman Brewery Historic District (2 miles), Montana State University (3 miles), Museum of the Rockies (4 miles)
AIRPORT: Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (9 miles)

name: Bozeman Bungalow: Pet Friendly w/ Fenced Yard
description: Centrally-located in Bozeman’s west side neighborhood this 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom townhome is perfect for your long stay. A fenced yard, covered patio and peaceful outdoor space are yours to relax in. Directly across from a 9 acre park, with a stunning view of Bozeman’s Bridger mountains. There is a one car garage for parking or extra storage needs. The open space kitchen, dining and living room with vaulted ceilings are perfect for preparing meals or relaxing after a full day of adventure.
neighborhood_overview: Located on Bozeman's west side near the newly built Gallatin High School. This townhome is directly across from a large city park, perfect to go walk with your dog. This is a quite neighborhood with families located about 4 miles from downtown Bozeman.
host_about: Hello! I am a thirty something enjoying life in Bozeman, Montana. I grew up in the Seattle, WA area but moved to Bozeman 20 years ago to attend Montana State University. After college, I traveled for the next few years to recruit students to attend MSU. I was able to travel all around Montana and many other states from Alaska to Virginia. The last few years I have ignited my passion for pets and gotten involved in the retail pet industry.

name: Bright, Cozy Cottage w/ Parking | Walk to Downtown
description:
Experience the best of Bozeman from this cozy sanctuary, perfectly situated in the heart of town. This charming cottage is well-equipped to make you feel right at home, nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood filled with trees and close to a park. Whether you're here to ski, fish, hike, bike, visit the university, work, or explore downtown, our prime location offers easy access to all the action while providing a smooth stay.

*Driveway parking
*Laundry
*Full kitchen
*Walk to local Co-Op
neighborhood_overview:
We are situated in one of the best locations in Bozeman! Nestled in a lovely walkable neighborhood, enjoy being 3 blocks away from Cooper Park. Enjoy the beautiful greenspace with mature trees, picnic tables, friendly dogs, and students playing frisbee. It's a great place for a stroll or a picnic.

Four blocks north, you'll reach the Bozeman Community Food Co-op where you can find local, organic produce and grocery staples, plus a fantastic hot bar, grab-and-go food options, fresh flowers, toiletries, and more.

You're a half-mile walk to Starbucks or Maven's Market, a gourmet cheese, sandwich, and gelato shop. Walk to downtown Bozeman where you’ll find cute coffee shops, great dining options, locally-owned boutiques, cool bars, and much more!

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellows
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Southbridge Cottage: Cozy and Modern Home (NEW)
description: This fabulous, single level, 3 bedroom, 2 bath house is great for everyone! The open floor plan combines the dining, kitchen, and living room with large windows and plenty of natural light. This cheerful home is located in south Bozeman. Montana State University is just 2 miles away!
neighborhood_overview:
The Southbridge subdivision in Bozeman, Montana, offers a charming and picturesque setting for short-term rental homes, nestled within the stunning natural beauty of the Gallatin Valley. Bozeman itself is a vibrant and thriving city renowned for its unique blend of outdoor adventure, cultural attractions, and small-town charm.

Southbridge is ideally situated just a short distance from downtown Bozeman, providing guests with convenient access to a plethora of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The subdivision boasts well-maintained streets lined with beautiful homes, offering a tranquil retreat for visitors seeking relaxation and rejuvenation.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the abundance of outdoor recreational opportunities available in the surrounding area, including hiking, fishing, skiing, and more. The nearby Bridger Mountains and Gallatin National Forest offer endless opportunities for exploration and adventure, making Southbridge an ideal desti
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

description:
Discover Bozeman from our central 3-bedroom retreat! Just blocks from Main St., parks, and so much more. Ideal for families, friends, or groups.

Normally we rent this apartment by the room but when you choose this listing you have the entire 3 bedroom basement apartment to yourself. Two queen sized beds and one full bed with a living room, dining room, full kitchen and bathroom.

neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located within walking distance, you'll find Bogert and Lindley Parks, where all the summer festivals come to life. name: Modern Bozeman Condo w/ Balcony & Mountain Views!
description: Your next long-term stay in Montana awaits at this 2-bed, 2-bath Bozeman vacation rental! Perfect for nature enthusiasts, this condo features an open living area with a Smart TV, a fully stocked kitchen, and access to the area’s top attractions and outdoor recreation. Enjoy a morning round of disc golf at Rose Park, then cast a line in the Gallatin River! Seeking a day trip? Shred the slopes at Big Sky Resort or explore Yellowstone National Park. The options are endless and the choice is yours!

ATTRACTIONS: The ELM (2 miles), Montana State University (2 miles), Museum of the Rockies (4 miles)
AIRPORT: Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (9 miles)

name: Fantastic Location | Free Breakfast
description:
Residence Inn Bozeman Downtown Hotel is the perfect setting for an extraordinary Rocky Mountain experience.

Just nearby you can:
✔ Admire Yellowstone’s dramatic canyons, alpine rivers, lush forests, hot springs and gushing geysers
✔ Ski with an unforgettable view
✔ Explore the history of computing, communications, artificial intelligence and robotics
at The American Computer & Robotics Museum
✔ Watch a show at Ellen Theatre
✔ Take a tour at the award winning distillery Bozeman Spirits

name: Alpine Cottage
description: New for 2024! Fast WiFi. Keyless self check-in.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Bright & Cozy 1Bdrm Loft | Walk to MSU & Downtown
description:
Experience the best of Bozeman in our cozy, beautifully decorated 1 bedroom loft. Perfect for MSU parents, conference attendees, or anyone exploring the area, this retreat is conveniently located on Bozeman’s southside in a lovely, green neighborhood. Walk to Montana State University, downtown, and numerous parks and trails, then return to the loft to unwind in comfort. This home perfectly blends convenience and charm.

*Full kitchen
*Well stocked
*Laundry in unit
*Clean & bright
neighborhood_overview:
The loft sits above a garage in the Capitol Hill Subdivision, Bozeman's oldest historic neighborhood near the MSU campus. Main Street is less than a mile away, with excellent coffee shops and restaurants just blocks from home. Built in 1939, the house was renovated in 2016, including the loft where you're staying. The lush, pedestrian-friendly area offers a serene retreat with beautiful historic homes throughout the neighborhood.

The stay is conveniently located only 13 miles from Bozeman’s Yellowstone International Airport. Additionally, Bridger Bowl Ski Area and Crosscut Cross-Country Ski Area are a short 17-mile drive away, with Big Sky Resort just 43 miles from your doorstep. Explore the stunning North Entrance of Yellowstone, an easy 80-mile scenic drive from the property.

In addition to hiking, biking, and trail running accessible from town, you can enjoy fishing on the nearby East Gallatin and main Gallatin Rivers, horseback riding, rafting, tours of Yellow
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Fantastic Location | Free Breakfast
description:
Residence Inn Bozeman Downtown Hotel is the perfect setting for an extraordinary Rocky Mountain experience.

Just nearby you can:
✔ Admire Yellowstone’s dramatic canyons, alpine rivers, lush forests, hot springs and gushing geysers
✔ Ski with an unforgettable view
✔ Explore the history of computing, communications, artificial intelligence and robotics
at The American Computer & Robotics Museum
✔ Watch a show at Ellen Theatre
✔ Take a tour at the award winning distillery Bozeman Spirits
neighborhood_overview:
▶ Activities and Cultural Attractions
— Yellowstone National Park – 1 h 37 min drive
— Big Sky Ski Resort – 1h 9 min drive
— Bridger Bowl – 23 min drive
— Ellen Theatre – 3 min drive/ 14 min walk
— Glen Lake Rotary Park – 6 min drive
— Gallatin Valley Mall – 10 min drive
— Palisade Falls – 45 min drive
— Bozeman Hot Springs – 19 min drive

▶ Places to eat and drink
— SAPPHIRE BAR & RESTAURANT – at the hotel
— Plonk – 3 min drive/ 13 min walk
— Montana Ale Works – 1min drive/ 3 min walk
— Blackbird Kitchen – 2 min drive/ 11 min walk
— Copper Whiskey Bar & Grill – 3min drive/12 min walk
— Ted's Montana Grill – 4 min drive/ 16 min walk
— Jam! – 3 min drive/ 15 min walk
— Seven Sushi – 5 min drive/ 30 min walk

▶ Places to visit
— Museum of the Rockies – 8 min drive
— American Computer and Robotics Museum – 8 min drive
— Gallatin

name: Realm  | Yellowstone . Free Breakfast
description:
Residence Inn Bozeman Downtown Hotel is the perfect setting for an extraordinary Rocky Mountain experience.

Just nearby you can:
✔ Admire Yellowstone’s dramatic canyons, alpine rivers, lush forests, hot springs and gushing geysers
✔ Ski with an unforgettable view
✔ Explore the history of computing, communications, artificial intelligence and robotics
at The American Computer & Robotics Museum
✔ Watch a show at Ellen Theatre
✔ Take a tour at the award winning distillery Bozeman Spirits
neighborhood_overview:
▶ Activities and Cultural Attractions
— Yellowstone National Park – 1 h 37 min drive
— Big Sky Ski Resort – 1h 9 min drive
— Bridger Bowl – 23 min drive
— Ellen Theatre – 3 min drive/ 14 min walk
— Glen Lake Rotary Park – 6 min drive
— Gallatin Valley Mall – 10 min drive
— Palisade Falls – 45 min drive
— Bozeman Hot Springs – 19 min drive

▶ Places to eat and drink
— SAPPHIRE BAR & RESTAURANT – at the hotel
— Plonk – 3 min drive/ 13 min walk
— Montana Ale Works – 1min drive/ 3 min walk
— Blackbird Kitchen – 2 min drive/ 11 min walk
— Copper Whiskey Bar & Grill – 3min drive/12 min walk
— Ted's Montana Grill – 4 min drive/ 16 min walk
— Jam! – 3 min drive/ 15 min walk
— Seven Sushi – 5 min drive/ 30 min walk

▶ Places to visit
— Museum of the Rockies – 8 min drive
— American Computer and Robotics Museum – 8 min drive
— Gallatin

name: Basecamp Bozeman - Downtown
description: Be close to everything at this centrally-located historic district home. Basecamp Bozeman; a bright & spacious 4200 sq ft. house with plenty of room for everyone. Located in the heart of historic Bozeman, enjoy all the best the area has to offer just outside your door––across the street from Cooper Park, 2 blocks from MSU & a few more blocks to all the shops & restaurants on Main street.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about: Thanks for taking a look and considering our vacation rental.  I began hosting  with our home vacation home in Hawaii in 2015.  A few years later,  my daughter and I started our own Real Estate Brokerage and Property Management Firm called Range Properties Montana.  We manage our rentals plus those of our clients. We seek to give you a 5 star experience with comfortable and well equipped place to stay.  Enjoy!

name: Cozy Historic Hideaway in Downtown Bozeman
description: Nestled in the basement of a charming historic property, this cozy 850 sq ft, two-bedroom, one-bathroom unit offers a private retreat in downtown Bozeman. With a blend of old-world charm and modern updates, the unit features in-unit laundry and amenities ideal for monthly stays. Just a block from Historic Main Street and near parks and trails, this space provides easy access to all Bozeman has to offer, making it perfect for those looking to embrace the vibrant downtown lifestyle.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about:
I'm a Bozeman native who lives in Austin with my wife, four daughters and our goldendoodle, Burrbon. We've lived in Chicago, Baltimore, and perhaps one day we'll be back in Montana. Until then, we love getting up there to visit when we can. We love the Sweet Pea festival and skiing Bridger and Big Sky. 

We love travel, adventure and creating memories together as a family.

neighborhood_overview:
A hot spot for investment and opportunity, Bozeman has attracted the nation’s eye. This idyllic town is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter the time of year. Located in the most exclusive location in Downtown Bozeman, RH is exclusivity and privacy in the center of the city. The property is in the central business district offering convenient access to restaurants, shops, and nightlife. Within six blocks of RH, you’ll find numerous eateries and boutique shops, right within walking distance. The area offers dining options like Little Star Diner, a farm-to-table restaurant just a block away, known for locally sourced dishes. A short walk further brings you to Main Street where Blackbird Kitchen serves up handcrafted pizzas and Italian-inspired cuisine. Outside of restaurants, you’ll also find a nearby French bakery and cafe, Vienne, and dessert options such as La Chatelaine Chocolat Co.

Beyond the cityscape, in the warmer months you

name: Cinnabar Suite - Mountain Views
description: The Cinnabar Suite is a stylish 1-BR, 1.5-BA apartment in the heart of Bozeman, offering incredible Bridger Mountain views from the 3rd floor. It features a spacious king-size bedroom, high-speed WiFi, a fully equipped kitchen, in-unit laundry, and a cozy living area. A covered parking space adds convenience, while its central location makes exploring downtown Bozeman’s restaurants, shops, and the surrounding natural beauty easy. The Cinnabar Suite is perfect for both relaxation and adventure.
neighborhood_overview: Excellent neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and everything you need for a comfortable stay.
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Comfy Modern Industrial Condo
description:
Modern, industrial designed flat/1-bedroom condo. Great location with easy access to downtown Bozeman, Big Sky and Bridger Bowl. King size bed in the bedroom and a queen blow up mattress for kids and guests.
Comfortable and spacious, this unit is well stocked with amenities.
Guest access
Two parking spaces directly in front of condo. Access code for the keypad door lock will be provided day of arrival. No in-person meetings required. Owners live nearby to address any needs during your stay.
